comments.author: John
comments.content: Sounds REALLY good. It also reminds me of a favorite at our house -- from "The James Beard Celebration," a recipe for Crepes aux Duxelles: basically it's a lot like yours, except that instead of chocolate filling and a sweet crepes, you make the crepes batter without sugar, and between crepe layers you put duxelles -- the result of cooking down finely-chopped mushrooms until they almost start to dry out. As with yours, the edges are a little messy, but wedge-shapes slices look great. Garnished with a drizzling of rich reduced stock and a few leaves of parsley, they make a great first course.

comments.author: DessertObsessed
comments.content: wow this is gorgeous! i definitely need to try this soon!

comments.author: DessertObsessed
comments.content: btw how do you make dulce de leche with a pressure cooker?!

comments.content: Happy Birthday!  Nice challenging 'cake'; it looks delicious.

comments.content: I don't think I could make this without making a huge mess, but it looks gorgeous.

comments.author: Alessandra

Happy Birthday!

The cake looks too good for words...:-)

comments.author: Xiaolu @ 6 Bittersweets
comments.content: I've made dulce de leche with my pressure cooker and agree that it's surprisingly easy other than the nail-biting over whether it would explode and destroy my kitchen ;p. This is one stunner of a cake. Happy belated b-day!

comments.author: Dana Zia
comments.content: Michael these had me at hello! They are beautiful! Thanks for sharing all your luscious recipes. May your new year be filled with lots of love, health and good food! Dana Zia

comments.author: Ashley
comments.content: The messiest desserts always taste the best. Seriously, I think it's gorgeous with all that gooey goodness seeping out. Thanks for sharing.

comments.author: Ten Gone
comments.content: Ohhhh my GOSH does that look YUMMY... crepes in any form are delicious, but I never thought to layer them like that...

comments.author: Renai
comments.content: This reminds me of Russian Honey Cake... except the idea of chocolate and dulce de leche is making me want to cry (in a really good way). My experience making a 15 layer Russian Honey Cake is here- http://www.areyoumyghost.com/2009/09/15-layer-russian-honey-cake.html

comments.content: Look delicious.... i will give it a try too...
